fields.headline: Keane mourns rivalries
fields.bodyText: Roy Keane is relishing tomorrow's match at Arsenal, but the Sunderland manager was yesterday nostalgic for his visits there as a Manchester United player. "It was a brilliant rivalry," Keane, left, said. "You would give anything to be playing in one of those games again. If you're on about football losing its soul, those rivalries have gone now . . . The Premier League is too predictable and it's sad. The big three or four will get bigger and they'll only go away from the other teams . . . I don't think the strength in depth in the Premier League is as good as it was. It's a tough league, but I still think it was more competitive three or four years ago."
